page.title: 04HOUSING IN LAUGHARNE
page.content: Described in the early 19th Century as "one of the best-built little towns in Carmarthenshire", Laugharne has about 28 Listed Buildings, some with Group Value. Home Improvement Grants and Conservation Area Grants have enabled repairs and restoration to some of the older houses. A Council House Estate, Orchard Park, adjoining the old Town, contains 60 houses, rented at Â£17.50 to Â£24.80 p w and a newer Council estate, Frogmore Gardens, built in the last decade, rent at Â£19.50 to Â£22.20 p w. There are few garages on either estate or the older part of town. Domestic Rates are Â£1.76 per rateable Â£. Private house prices average Â£35,000. Flats for let, holiday homes, a Mobile Home Park and a home- less parents home make up the rest. Eleven new houses built this year, a few also empty.
